Organization: Law Office Of Stephen L. Braga, PLLC
Request Description: Requesting the following information concerning Feld Entertainment Inc. (FEI). (1) All records concerning investigations or other fact-finding activities concerning FEI, obtained, sought, collected or generated by the USDA since January 1, 2008; (2) All records that in any way relate to or were the subject of the settlement that was entered into between the USDA and FEI announced to the public on November 28, 2011, (a copy of the agency 's Press Release is attached for your convenience); (3) All inspection documents generated by the USDA since January 1, 2008, that indicate­ an actual or potential violation by FEI of the Animal Welfare Act, 7 U.S .C. § 2131 et seq. (WAP); (4) All records concerning: (a) The investigation of the death of Clyde, a young lion owned by FEI, in­ including but not limited to the final USDA Investigative Report; (b) Investigations of mistreatment of an elephant named Angelica allegedly recorded on videotape by Deniz Bolbo, including but not limited to the USDA's final Investigative Report; (c) Investigations, since January 1, 2008, of mistreatment of an FEI elephant named Sara or Sarah; (d) Investigations or consideration of allegations that officials or employees of FEI misled, lied to, or otherwise provided incorrect or false information to the USDA concerning events surrounding the death of an elephant named Riccardo; (e) Investigations or consideration of allegations or observations since January 1, 2008, of FEI elephants with lameness or other physical problems; (f) FEI attempts to delay, impede, or in any way interfere with USDA or any other governmental inspections of any of its animals since January 1, 2008; (g) Any video footage submitted to the USDA by People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals since January 1, 2008, allegedly showing FEI em­ employees hitting elephants; (h) Any photographs allegedly taken by former FEI employee Sam Haddock that depict young elephants being "trained " by FEI, tied up in ropes or chains, or otherwise restrained; (i) Any evidence, obtained or generated by the agency since January 1, 2008, concerning whether FEI elephants may have tested positive for tuberculosis, according to any test applied to such elephants; (j) Any allegations and/or related information that in June 2012, a security guard at an arena in Colorado Springs named Darrin Sparks saw an FEI employee hitting an elephant with a bull hook, and also reported seeing mistreatment of dogs and tigers by FEI; and (k) Any allegations and/or related information that in April 2013 the Director of Events at the Nassau Coliseum in New York, named Michelle Comado, saw an elephant being beaten by FEI employees on the Red Unit.
